verses.text: After these \add things\add* Tobias went \add his way\add*, praising God that he had given him a prosperous journey, and blessed Raguel and Edna his wife, and went on \add his way\add* till they drew near unto Nineve.
Then Raphael said to Tobias, Thou knowest, brother, how thou didst leave thy father:
let us haste before thy wife, and prepare the house.
And take in \add thine\add* hand the gall of the fish. So they went \add their way\add*, and the dog went after them.
Now Anna sat looking about towards the way for her son.
And when she espied him coming, she said to his father, Behold, thy son cometh, and the man that went with him.
Then said Raphael, I know, Tobias, that thy father will open \add his\add* eyes.
Therefore anoint thou his eyes with the gall, and being pricked \add therewith\add*, he shall rub, and the whiteness shall fall away, and he shall see thee.
Then Anna ran forth, and fell upon the neck of her son, and said unto him, \add Seeing\add* I have seen thee, \add my\add* son, from henceforth I am content to die. And they wept both.
Tobit also went forth toward the door, and stumbled: but his son ran unto him,
and took hold of his father: and he strake \add of\add* the gall on his father’s eyes, saying, Be of good hope, \add my\add* father.
And when his eyes began to smart, he rubbed them;
and the whiteness pilled away from the corners of his eyes: and when he saw his son, he fell upon his neck.
And he wept, and said, Blessed art thou, O God, and blessed \add is\add* thy name for ever; and blessed \add are\add* all thy holy angels:
for thou hast scourged, and hast taken pity on me: for behold, I see my son Tobias. And his son went in rejoicing, and told his father the great things that had happened to him in Media.
Then Tobit went out to meet his daughter in law at the gate of Nineve, rejoicing, and praising God: and they which saw him go marvelled, because he had received his sight.

But Tobit gave thanks before them, because God had mercy on him. And when he came near to Sara his daughter in law, he blessed her, saying, Thou art welcome, daughter: God \add be\add* blessed, which hath brought thee unto us, and \add blessed be\add* thy father and thy mother. And there was joy amongst all his brethren which were at Nineve.
And Achiacharus, and Nasbas his brother’s son, came:
and Tobias’ wedding was kept seven days with \add great\add* joy.
